revised_title: Cranial Dimensions of St Kitts and African Green Monkeys
tldr: This study compares the cranial dimensions of St Kitts and African green monkeys, finding that the skulls of the isolated St Kitts monkeys are larger and less variable than those of their mainland counterparts. The changes in skull size and variability are most noticeable in measurements of skull breadth and parallel the changes observed in the monkeys' teeth. These findings suggest that the effects of geographic isolation may have led to these differences in skull morphology.
